easy.question: Who is the author of The Lord of the Rings?
What is the name of the wizard in The Lord of the Rings?
Who is Frodo's loyal friend and companion?
How are Bilbo and Frodo Baggins related?
What effect does Bilbo’s ring have on its wearer?
easy.b: It enables him to see in the dark

easy.question: How did Bilbo come into possession of his ring?
easy.b: He won it in a battle
easy.c: He found it in a cave
easy.d: He found it at the bottom of a river

easy.question: To which of the following is the landscape of the Shire most similar?
Which of the following hobbits does not set out on the quest with Frodo?
How many Black Riders are there?
What type of tree ensnares Merry in the Old Forest?
What are Tom Bombadil’s origins?
easy.a: He is a being from deep inside the earth
easy.b: He is from the unknown West across the Great Sea
easy.c: He is the brother of Old Man Willow

easy.question: What is the name of the inn at Bree?
Which important character do the hobbits meet at the inn?
What is the name of the fiery mountain where the One Ring was forged?
Of what races are Legolas and Gimli, respectively?
What is Legolas’s weapon of choice?
Moria was once an ancient realm of which race?
Which terrible creature does Gandalf battle during the journey through Moria?
What are Gandalf’s final words before he falls into the chasm?
easy.b: “All that is gold does not glitter!”

easy.question: Over which realm does Galadriel rule?
Which of the following does Frodo not see in Galadriel’s mirror?
easy.b: An old figure dressed in white
easy.d: A dark eye rimmed in fire

easy.question: Why does Galadriel refuse the Ring when Frodo offers it?
easy.a: She knows it would corrupt her
easy.b: The metal from which it is made is fatal to Elves
easy.c: It does not fit on her finger

easy.question: To which city does Boromir suggest the Fellowship go?
What are lembas?
easy.b: A type of flower that grows in Lothlórien

easy.question: Which creature does Aragorn assert has been following the Fellowship throughout the journey?
Which of the following best characterizes Boromir’s attitude toward the Ring?
easy.a: He cannot see the importance of it
easy.b: He thinks its power is merely a myth
easy.c: He begins to be corrupted by it
easy.d: He cannot stand the sight of it

easy.question: With which companion does Frodo set out at the end of The Fellowship of the Ring?
